definitions: the sport or skill of throwing and handling ropes especially in rodeo events
ornamental arrangement or pattern made with rope or rope-like material
examples: The cowboy demonstrated his roping skills at the ranch
She spent years perfecting her roping technique for competitions
The Christmas tree featured traditional roping around its branches
Gold roping adorned the edges of the ceremonial curtains

definitions: string of beads used for counting prayers in Catholic devotion
garden or bed where roses are cultivated
examples: She held her grandmother's rosary during the memorial service
The wooden rosary beads clicked softly as he prayed
The monastery's rosary bloomed beautifully every spring season
Visitors enjoyed walking through the fragrant rosary at sunset

definitions: young rose flower that has not yet opened its petals
examples: The pink rosebud slowly unfurled in the morning sun
She pinned a delicate rosebud to her wedding dress

definitions: evergreen herb with needle-like leaves used in cooking and medicine
examples: Fresh rosemary adds wonderful flavor to roasted potatoes
The garden path was lined with fragrant rosemary bushes

definitions: rose-shaped decoration made of ribbon or other material
circular ornamental design in architecture or carved work
circular arrangement of leaves growing from a central point
examples: The prize winner received a blue rosette at the competition
She crafted beautiful rosettes from silk ribbon for decorations
Gothic cathedrals often feature stone rosettes above doorways
The ceiling displayed intricate plaster rosettes around the chandelier
The succulent formed a perfect rosette of thick green leaves
Dandelion leaves grow in rosettes close to the ground

definitions: dark reddish hardwood from tropical trees valued for furniture making
examples: The antique desk was crafted from Brazilian rosewood
Rosewood guitars produce exceptionally warm and rich tones

definitions: solid amber substance obtained from pine trees used on violin bows
examples: The violinist carefully applied rosin to her bow strings
Baseball pitchers sometimes use rosin bags for better grip

definitions: organized list of people belonging to a group or scheduled for duties
examples: The coach posted the team roster before the first game
Her name appeared on the duty roster for night shifts

definitions: raised platform or podium used for public speaking or conducting
projecting beak-like part of certain animals or anatomical structures
decorated prow of ancient warship used as speaker's platform
examples: The professor approached the rostrum to begin her lecture
The conductor stepped onto the rostrum and raised his baton
The dolphin's rostrum helps it navigate through murky water
Scientists measured the rostrum length of various bird species
Ancient Roman speakers addressed crowds from captured ship rostrums
The museum displayed a bronze rostrum from a Greek warship

definitions: decomposition of organic matter caused by bacteria or fungi
foolish or worthless talk or ideas considered meaningless
examples: The fallen tree showed signs of advanced rot inside
Moisture in the walls can lead to dangerous wood rot
Don't believe that rot about instant wealth schemes online
He dismissed their complaints as complete and utter rot

definitions: list showing turns of duty or service rotation among group members
examples: The cleaning rota ensures everyone takes their fair turn
Check the rota to see when you're scheduled to work

definitions: mechanical device or system that operates by rotating motion
circular intersection where traffic moves around a central island
international service club organization focused on community service
examples: The rotary engine uses a different design than pistons
An old rotary phone sat on the antique shop shelf
Take the second exit at the rotary to reach downtown
The new rotary improved traffic flow at the busy intersection
She joined the local Rotary club to help community projects
The Rotary sponsored scholarships for deserving high school students

definitions: circular movement of an object around its axis or center point
regular alternation of position duties or crops in systematic sequence
examples: The Earth completes one rotation every twenty-four hours approximately
The wheel's rotation speed determines the vehicle's forward motion
Crop rotation helps maintain healthy soil in farming practices
The hospital uses rotation schedules for resident doctor training

definitions: learning method based on repetition without understanding the meaning
examples: Students memorized multiplication tables through rote learning methods
Teaching by rote doesn't encourage critical thinking skills development

definitions: rotating component of a machine especially in motors or helicopters
examples: The helicopter's main rotor provides lift for vertical flight
The mechanic replaced the worn brake rotors on the car

definitions: ongoing decay of organic matter through bacterial or fungal action
examples: The smell of rotting leaves filled the autumn forest air
Prevent rotting by storing vegetables in cool dry conditions

definitions: round building or room especially one with a dome overhead
examples: The capitol's rotunda features beautiful painted ceiling murals
Wedding guests gathered in the museum's marble rotunda space

definitions: red powder or cream used to color cheeks or lips
fine powder used for polishing metal or glass surfaces
examples: She applied a touch of rouge to her pale cheeks
Victorian ladies often used rouge despite social disapproval attitudes
The jeweler used rouge to polish the silver to shine
Fine rouge powder brings out the luster in gemstones

definitions: casino game where players bet on which numbered compartment a ball lands
examples: They played roulette at the casino until late at night
The roulette wheel spun as players placed their final bets

definitions: circular intersection where traffic flows around a central island
indirect or circuitous way of doing or saying something
examples: The new roundabout replaced the dangerous four-way stop intersection
Drivers must yield when entering the busy downtown roundabout
She took a roundabout approach to asking for a raise
His roundabout explanation only confused the audience even more

definitions: circular building for housing and maintaining railroad locomotives
wide swinging punch delivered with full arm rotation
examples: The historic roundhouse now serves as a railroad museum
Steam engines were serviced in the massive railway roundhouse
The boxer knocked out his opponent with a powerful roundhouse
She practiced roundhouse kicks during her martial arts training

definitions: process of making something round or curved in shape
mathematical process of replacing a number with simpler approximate value
examples: The carpenter focused on rounding the table's sharp corners
Rounding the edges made the furniture safer for children
When rounding decimals, consider the digit after your target
The accountant was rounding figures to the nearest dollar amount

definitions: conference or discussion where participants have equal status and input
examples: The CEO organized a roundtable with all department heads
The roundtable discussion produced several innovative solutions together

definitions: gathering of cattle or horses from range for counting or branding
summary or collection of news events or information
examples: The annual cattle roundup takes place every spring season
Cowboys prepared their horses for the week-long roundup event
Here's your daily roundup of international news headlines today
The sports roundup covered all major league game results

definitions: quality of stirring strong emotions enthusiasm or excitement in others
examples: The coach gave a rousing speech before the championship game
The crowd erupted after the candidate's rousing campaign speech

definitions: complete defeat causing enemy forces to flee in panic
disorderly retreat of defeated troops in complete confusion
examples: The battle ended in a complete rout of enemy forces
The underdog team turned the game into an unexpected rout
The army's rout left equipment scattered across the battlefield
Historians described the chaotic rout following the surprise attack

definitions: electronic device that forwards data between computer networks
power tool for hollowing out or shaping wood surfaces
examples: The wireless router provides internet access throughout the house
Reset the router if your internet connection stops working
He used a router to create decorative edges on cabinets
The router bit carved precise grooves in the wood

definitions: cooked mixture of flour and fat used to thicken sauces
examples: Start the gumbo by making a dark roux with oil
The chef stirred the roux constantly to prevent it burning

definitions: person who travels from place to place without fixed destination
vehicle designed for exploring planetary surfaces or rough terrain
examples: The old rover traveled from town to town selling goods
Irish rovers were known for their wandering musical performances
The Mars rover transmitted stunning images from the red planet
Scientists controlled the lunar rover from mission control headquarters

definitions: act of moving about from place to place without fixed purpose
continuous strand of fibers prepared for spinning into yarn
examples: His roving lifestyle took him to many different countries
The reporter's roving assignment covered events across the region
She purchased merino roving to spin into soft warm yarn
The roving must be carefully drafted during the spinning process

definitions: small boat propelled by oars rather than sails or motor
examples: They rented a rowboat to explore the peaceful lake
The old wooden rowboat leaked slightly but stayed afloat

definitions: person who behaves in a rough noisy or disorderly way
examples: Security removed the rowdy from the concert venue immediately
A group of rowdies disrupted the peaceful neighborhood gathering

definitions: person who propels a boat using oars especially in competitions
examples: The Olympic rower trained six hours daily for competitions
Each rower must synchronize perfectly with their teammates' strokes

definitions: sport or activity of propelling boats using oars in water
examples: She took up rowing to improve her fitness levels
The university's rowing team practices on the river daily

definitions: person who supports or advocates for a monarchical system of government
examples: The royalist party campaigned to restore the monarchy's power
During the civil war, royalists fought against republican forces

definitions: members of a royal family including kings queens and princes
payment made to owner for use of property patent or copyright
examples: European royalty gathered for the prestigious state wedding ceremony
The museum displayed jewels once worn by French royalty
Authors receive royalty payments for each book sold worldwide
The inventor earned substantial royalties from her patented design

definitions: revolutions per minute measuring rotational speed of mechanical devices
examples: The engine idle speed should be around 800 rpm
Increase the drill's rpm for faster cutting through metal

definitions: elastic waterproof substance made from latex or synthetic materials
small piece of rubber used to erase pencil marks
examples: Car tires are made from specially formulated rubber compounds
The rubber gasket creates a watertight seal between parts
She used a rubber to correct the mistake in her drawing
Keep a good rubber handy during mathematics examinations

definitions: action of moving something back and forth against a surface
technique of creating an impression by rubbing over raised surface
examples: Constant rubbing wore a hole in his jacket pocket
The cat enjoys rubbing against people's legs for attention
She made a rubbing of the ancient stone inscription
Brass rubbing reveals intricate details of medieval church monuments

definitions: waste or worthless material that is thrown away as garbage
ideas or statements considered worthless nonsensical or untrue
examples: The bins overflowed with rubbish after the outdoor festival
Please sort recyclables from general rubbish before disposal
Don't believe that rubbish about overnight success formulas
The critic dismissed the film as absolute rubbish

definitions: broken fragments of stone brick or concrete from demolished buildings
examples: Rescue workers searched through rubble for earthquake survivors
The demolition left piles of rubble where buildings stood

definitions: naive or unsophisticated person especially from rural areas
examples: The city slickers tried to swindle the unsuspecting rube
Don't act like a rube when visiting the big city

definitions: contagious viral infection causing red rash also called German measles
examples: Pregnant women should avoid exposure to rubella infection risks
The rubella vaccine has nearly eliminated the disease worldwide

definitions: basic monetary unit of Russia and some former Soviet states
examples: The tourist exchanged dollars for rubles at the bank
The ruble's value fluctuated against international currencies significantly

definitions: set of criteria used for assessing or grading performance
heading or category under which something is classified
examples: The teacher provided a detailed rubric for the essay assignment
Students consulted the rubric to understand grading expectations clearly
This issue falls under the rubric of workplace safety regulations
Various topics were organized under different rubrics for clarity

definitions: precious red gemstone variety of corundum valued for jewelry
dynamic open-source programming language focused on simplicity and productivity
examples: The engagement ring featured a stunning Burmese ruby centerpiece
Natural rubies command higher prices than synthetic ones significantly
She learned Ruby to develop web applications more efficiently
Many startups choose Ruby for rapid application development projects

definitions: untidy fold or wrinkle in fabric or material
loose scrum formed around a tackled player in rugby
examples: Smooth out the ruck in the carpet before guests arrive
Her dress developed an annoying ruck at the waistline
Players competed fiercely for the ball in the ruck
The referee penalized illegal hands in the ruck formation

definitions: flat piece hinged vertically to ship or aircraft for steering
examples: The ship's rudder broke during the violent storm at sea
The pilot adjusted the rudder to correct the plane's direction
